I think this lab group could do a really good job of coming up as a group with interesting experiments to run if we started out some meeting with a broad question relevant to our shared interests - "Suppose you think X; how would you test it?", and then started trying to break all of the experiments we proposed.
Absolutely, Julian has a great lab set up, and has interesting outside speakers coming in. The lab group is very friendly and has produced some cool research.
